tuv.seg: An error occurred on the Laser sub-system
General error
An error occurred on the Laser sub-system
Hardware error
An error occurred on the Laser sub-system
Software error
An error occurred on the Laser sub-system
Pixel mapping error
An error occurred on the Laser sub-system
Calibration app error
VF-LCR Communications Initialization Timeout

This alarm will occur if none of the VFLCRs are enabled for use within 15 minutes since machine power up or after an E-stop or disabling laser safety. It is simply a notification. Enabling communications on the desired racks will eliminate the alarm.
VF-LCR Timeout Disabling Laser DC Power
One or more of the laser DC power supplies failed to indicate that DC power was OFF within 10 seconds of being commanded to turn OFF. Check wiring for the laser dc power supplies
VF-LCR Timeout Enabling Laser DC Power
One or more of the laser DC power supplies failed to indicate that DC power was ON within 30 seconds of being commanded to turn ON. Check wiring for the laser dc power supplies
VF-LCR Timeout Disabling Laser Power / Emission
One or more of the lasers failed to indicate that both laser main power and emission were disabled within 4 seconds of being commanded to disable. Check wiring for the laser main power supply
VF-LCR Timeout Enabling Laser Power
One or more of the lasers failed to indicate that laser main power was enabled within 15 seconds of being commanded to enable.Check wiring for the laser main power supply
VF-LCR Timeout Enabling Laser Emission
One or more of the lasers failed to indicate that laser emission was enabled within 4 seconds of being commanded to enable.
VF-LCR Laser Safety Interlock Reset Required

An attempt was made to enable laser DC power or laser emission (or execute a "begin trajectory" command in a CNC program) while the laser safety interlocks were open. Close the interlocks (print zone door) and enable laser safety before attempting to use the lasers.
VF-LCR Timeout Prepare Trajectory
VF-LCR System Error
VFLCR System Error Present when attempting to open a layer or during printing operation. Check associated Fatal Laser Error Alarm for more information.
VF-LCR Timeout End Trajectory
VF-LCR Build Layout or Print Number Not Specified

When attempting to open a layer, if either of the two numbers that make up the build name are zero (i.e. the 'X' or 'Y' in VF-XXXXX-YYYY_Lnnnnn_Rrr.vflr) , this indicates an invalid build name, so the attempt to open the layer has been aborted.
VF-LCR System Error or Layer Already Open
{&LayerOpenFailString}
VF-LCR Timeout Opening Layer
The enabled VFLCRs were commanded to open the current layer but failed to complete this task within 2 seconds. Verify the name of the .vflr laser control file.
VF-LCR Current Layer Aborted

Currently open layer was successfully aborted. Check for any conditions that would have aborted Gantry or Laser function, such as crash sensors tripping or laser safety issues. All issues that would abort a layer originate with PLC signals, and are not initiated by the VFLCR.
VF-LCR Timeout Resetting System Error

An attempt was made to reset an existing "system error" on all enabled VFLCRs and one or more did not indicate that the error was reset within 500 milliseconds. Check for ongoing Laser Errors that have not been resolved.
VF-LCR Timeout Resetting Hardware Error

An attempt was made to reset an existing "hardware error" on all enabled VFLCRs and one or more did not indicate that the error was reset within 500 milliseconds. Check for ongoing Hardware Errors that have not been resolved.
VF-LCR Rack {&VFLCRAlarmRackNumber}: Communications Failure
Heartbeat from the VFCLR is not incrementing as expected. Check Powerlink communication and VFLCR LED Status lights
VF-LCR Rack {&VFLCRAlarmRackNumber}: Hardware Error
Hardware Errors include issues with the DC power supplies and laser controllers. Consult the VFLCR user guide for more information.
VF-LCR Rack {&VFLCRAlarmRackNumber}, Laser Power Supply {&VFLCRAlarmPowerSupplyNumber}: Fan Failure
The specified power supply indicates that one or more of its cooling fans have failed.
VF-LCR Rack {&VFLCRAlarmRackNumber}, Laser Power Supply {&VFLCRAlarmPowerSupplyNumber}: Overtemperature
The specified power supply indicates that it has exceeded recommended operating temperature
VF-LCR Rack {&VFLCRAlarmRackNumber}, Laser Power Supply {&VFLCRAlarmPowerSupplyNumber}: AC Input Low Voltage
The specified power supply indicates that the AC input voltage is low. This alarm has often been indicative that the entire power supply has failed and requires replacement.
VF-LCR Rack {&VFLCRAlarmRackNumber}, Laser Power Supply {&VFLCRAlarmPowerSupplyNumber}: DC Output Failure

The specified power supply indicates that the DC output has failed. This could indicate that the entire power supply has failed or possibly that the voltage feedback signal wires from the output bus bars to the internal controller board is missing or broken.
[unused] VF-LCR Rack {&VFLCRAlarmRackNumber}, Laser {&VFLCRAlarmLaserNumber} [Pixel {&VFLCRAlarmPixelNumber}]: 'Control System Powered' Feedback Signal Missing
The specified laser does not indicate that it is receiving 24VDC control power or an internal failure has occurred in the laser controller.
VF-LCR Rack {&VFLCRAlarmRackNumber}, Laser {&VFLCRAlarmLaserNumber} [Pixel {&VFLCRAlarmPixelNumber}]: 'Laser Ready' Feedback Signal Missing

The specified laser does not indicate that it is "ready". For nLight lasers, this signal indicates an error or fault is reported by the laser. This may be the result of an internal error in the laser controller. Separate software may be used to communicate with the controller to determine the true nature of the failure.
VF-LCR Rack {&VFLCRAlarmRackNumber}, Laser {&VFLCRAlarmLaserNumber} [Pixel {&VFLCRAlarmPixelNumber}]: 'Laser Main Power Started' Feedback Signal Missing
The specified laser does not indicate that main laser power is enabled in response to the VFLCR enable request.
VF-LCR Rack {&VFLCRAlarmRackNumber}, Laser {&VFLCRAlarmLaserNumber} [Pixel {&VFLCRAlarmPixelNumber}]: 'Laser Emission On' Feedback Signal Missing
The specified laser does not indicate that laser emission is enabled in response to the VFLCR enable request.
VF-LCR Rack {&VFLCRAlarmRackNumber}, Laser {&VFLCRAlarmLaserNumber} [Pixel {&VFLCRAlarmPixelNumber}]: Laser Fatal Error
{&AdditionalInfoLaserFatal}
VF-LCR Rack {&VFLCRAlarmRackNumber}, Laser {&VFLCRAlarmLaserNumber} [Pixel {&VFLCRAlarmPixelNumber}]: Laser Watchdog Error
The VFLCR has determined that the specified laser's modulation signal was ON for a period longer than 1 second in auto mode, or more than 15 seconds in manual mode.
Powerlink (PCI Bus Slot 2) - Cycle/Sync Failure
Powerlink connection to laser racks and VF-LCR systems
VF-LCR Software or FPGA Firmware Version Mismatch
The Software and/or FPGA Firmware version number returned by the enabled VFLCRs is not identical. All VFLCRs must be running the same versions in order to use them for printing.
VF-LCR Laser Calibration ID Mismatch
The currently-loaded laser calibration LUT ID value is not the same on all of the enabled VFLCRs. The calibration LUT ID must be the same on all systems before printing is allowed.
VF-LCR Laser Calibration LUT File Load Failure

One or more of the enabled VFLCRs was unable to load its calibration LUT files. This could occur if one or more of the files are missing (21 are required per rack, even if not all 21 lasers are used), if any of the file names are incorrect (e.g. possibly files for a different rack), or if a file is corrupt based on a CRC check.
VF-LCR Rack/Laser-Pixel Map Not Defined for MachineID={&MachineID}
Rack/Laser to Pixel map must be defined for this machine based on optics box splicing procedure
VF-LCR Rack {&VFLCRAlarmRackNumber}: System Error
See related alarms for more detail
One or more enabled VFLCRs are not processing laser control files. Possible wiring issue between encoders/ PTR/VFLCR's. See Additional Information for a list of impacted VFLCRs.
{&TrajectoryMismatchRacks}
One or more enabled VFLCRs not indicating they are ready to print when the system is attempting to begin running build CNC code. See Additional Information for list of unready racks.
{&VFLCRNotReadyRackString}
VF-LCR Rack {&VFLCRAlarmRackNumber}: Command inhibited, see additional info
{&VFLCR_SW_COMMAND_INHIBIT_AL9207.snippet}
Pixel Map (.vfpmap) file not found
Please make sure the current pixel map file is present in the PixelMapping folder of the user partition
Pixel Map (.vfpmap) File Path Error
Pixel Map (.vfpmap) File Open Error
Pixel Map (.vfpmap) File Close Error
Pixel Map (.vfpmap) File Read Error
Check the file for improper formatting
Pixel Map (.vfpmap) File Data Error
Check the file for improper formatting and/or data values
Pixel Map (.vfpmap) Version Conflict with Current Build
A build file with a matching pixel map version must be loaded before printing
Pixel Used by Current Build is Ignored - pixel={&VFLCRAlarmPixelNumber} rack={&VFLCRAlarmRackNumber} laser={&VFLCRAlarmLaserNumber}
Pixels identified as being active (used) by the current build must not be Ignored
Pixel or Rack or Laser number value in vfpmap file exceed what is defined in the project
Max defined for project needs to be updated or vfpmap file has improper data. Max- Pixels:{&MaxPixelDefined}; Racks:{&MaxRackDefined} ;Lasers:{&MaxLasersDefined}
Laser Calibration App: Communications Failure
Heartbeat from the Laser Calibration App is not incrementing as expected. Check python app service.
Laser Calibration App: Command Timed Out - {&VFLCR_APP_COMMAND_TIMEOUT_AL9401.snippet}
PLC did not receive a timely response from the Laser Calibration App. Check python app service.
Task received a command before app was ready
{&VFLCR_APP_CMD_B4_READY_AL9402.snippet}
Laser Calibration App: Test Results Timed Out - {&VFLCR_APP_RESULTS_TIMEOUT_AL9403.snippet}
PLC did not receive processed test results in a timely manner. Check python app service.
Laser Calibration App: S3 Bucket Missing - {&VFLCR_APP_BUCKET_MISSING_AL9404.snippet}
Target S3 bucket for upload/download is not available. Check python app service.
Laser Calibration App: S3 Connection Failed - {&VFLCR_APP_S3_CONNECTION_AL9405.snippet}
Unable to connect to S3 file storage service. Check python app service.
Laser Calibration App: Data Capture Failed - {&VFLCR_APP_CAPTURE_FAILED_AL9406.snippet}
Pixel capture of pyrometer and camera data failed. Check python app service.
Lasers were powered off due to low optics box flow.
Check optics box flow
Lasers were powered off since the chiller is not running.
Check if chiller is running
{&PIXEL_ENABLE_MISMATCH_AL9309.snippet}
check build info file and laser settings page
Verification inhibited
Make sure calibrated LUT's are properly transfered to VFLCR's. Can check LUT number on Laser page. Should not be 9999- Linear
